Description: Willbros Group Inc., a company providing construction, engineering and other services in the oil and gas industry, and Willbros International Inc., its wholly owned subsidiary through which it conducted international operations, agreed to pay a $22 million criminal penalty in connection with corrupt payments to Nigerian and Ecuadoran government officials in violation of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/May/08-crm-417.html

Description: Willbros Group, Inc. agreed to pay $10.3 million to settle allegations that it violated the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) by paying more than $6 million in undisclosed bribes to Nigerian government officials and others to obtain contracts.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2008/2008-86.htm

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 237120: Oil and Gas Pipeline and Related Structures Construction
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
